containers.description: A container with random items.
This moth-eaten backpack is sticky with cobwebs.
A simple canvas bag, perfect for carrying almost anything.
The lip of the pack is stitched with the likeness of a helmeted warrior, their eyes sheltered. Something protrudes from the helm, like a strange, floppy arrow.
The day's catch. The smell suggests it's starting to go off.
A simple bag fashioned from a single piece of rough burlap.
A durable backpack, made for someone of small stature. Acrid black powder stains the canvas, and one of the leather straps in badly singed.
A threadbare backpack, filled inside and out with cobwebs.
This threadbare bag is patched in multiple places with a diverse array of worn-down fabrics and threads.
A warning is embroidered in shaky letters on the inside flap - 'HANDS OFF'.
A plain leather bag, cinched at the top with knotted cord.
Made of precious stone and covered in gold, this chest is both sturdy and pleasing to the eye.
A bloody handprint, still sticky to the touch, wraps around the iron handle of this heavy oak box, kept closed by a large iron lock.
The flesh-like lid of this rubbery container seems to quiver when touched.
This chest of animal skins and bones is held together by mud-covered straps.
Made of precious stone and covered in gold, this chest is both sturdy and pleasing to the eye.
An elaborate chest made from strange metals and wood you've never seen before.
Made of precious stone and covered in gold, this chest is both sturdy and pleasing to the eye.
Simply constructed and weatherworn, but it seems sturdy enough.
This chest's fire-hardened wood and thick iron reinforcements offer exceptional protection for any valuables - or secrets.
Though most of the wood is covered with green moss, this chest is still remarkably sturdy.
This exquisitely-crafted chest, ornamented with gems and lined with cushioned velvet, is fit for storing the finest treasures.
Every inch of this small chest is decorated with iron clasps.
Livelier than your typical chest of wood and metal, thanks to a thick coat of paint.
Though simple and weatherworn, this chest seems sturdy enough.
This chest's brass and silver inlays still gleam beneath a coating of rain-speckled grime.
Made from fire-hardened wood and iron, this heavy chest protects its contents from both the elements and thieves.
Far from impregnable, but roomy and lightweight.
A common chest of timber and iron.
What could have been a simple barrel is covered in silver filigree and encrusted with gems of all sizes, as if the maker had more time than sense.
Fastidiously separated from the rest of the skeleton and cleaned of flesh and organs.
A basic wooden barrel for storing liquids or other goods.
Sturdy enough to endure rocky voyages or decades stacked ten-deep in a dusty warehouse.
Built to accommodate items too large for a standard crate.
A heavy traveller's chest pockmarked with arrow strikes.
A small collection of various tinctures and tonics.
This once-fine vase has been cracked by either time or neglect.
A fisher's cask of some age. The wood itself emits a powerful briny smell.
This plank stands out as dislodged from the others.
Dusty fingerprints mottle the exterior of this worn traveller's trunk.
Precariously stacked tomes of varied thickness, each dustier than the one beneath.
Upon this desk ink pots and quills are neatly placed, likely the instruments of a prolific writer.
Books on various unrelated subjects, organised in no obvious order.
An assortment of unrelated objects line each shelf, following no clear rhyme or rhythm.
Speckles of dust peak at you from behind disorganised objects.
Precariously stacked tomes of varied thickness, each dustier than the one beneath.
A chest suitable for lashing to carts and wagons.
A simple wooden table, standing proudly on four legs.
A chest suitable for lashing to carts wagons.
A tightly bolted chest, waterproofed with a coat of linseed oil.
A desk littered with an assortment of objects.
As you meet the shelf at eye level, a small gathering of objects line to greet you.
Lovely, delicate, and quite old, judging by its dated design.
Something seems lodged inside the carcass, getting past the stench may prove difficult.
All food that is put into this bag immediately grows mould and spoils.
This book feels light in your hands. And strangely hollow.
Looking at this chest fills you with a suspiciously overwhelming feeling that there is absolutely nothing special about it.
A delectable feast perfuming the air with the comfortable aromatic smell of herbs and spices.
A bag of severed hands - wet with suspicious viscera.
A knitted toy bear stuffed with soft fur.
A patina of puce alchemical matter coats this pouch - hopefully not the former owner reduced to dust by their experiments.
Small compartments line the sack: a compass-sized furrow; a pocket packed with storing salts; and an area for stiff tent legs, fixing pegs, and folded canvas.
Though the keychain is lightly rusted from use, every new key that jangles on it is a mote of possibility - a frontier to explore.
